h1. Regular users {anchor:id=Forum_user_guide.Regular_userRoleNotInToc}
This section describes actions that a regular user can perform in the *Forum* application of eXo Platform.

h2. View details of the Forum application {anchor:id=Forum_user_guide.Regular_user.View_details}
Once clicking *Forum* on the *Administration* bar, you will be directed to the *Forum* homepage. Here, you can see categories of *Forum*, forums in each category, forum statistics as shown below:

!images/View_Forum_application.png|align="center" width="150mm" fo:scalefit="1" html:scalefit="0"!

h2. Search {anchor:id=Forum_user_guide.Forum_regular_user.Search}

Like in *Answers*, you can do either of two search types (*Quick Search* or *Advanced Search*) anywhere in the *Forum* application, right on the homepage or inside each specific forum or topic that makes it easy to find the expected information.

This function can be performed via:
* [Quick search|#Forum_user_guide.Forum_regular_user.Quick_search]
* [Advanced search|#Forum_user_guide.Forum_regular_user.Advanced_search]
h3. Quick search {anchor:id=Forum_user_guide.Forum_regular_user.Quick_search}
{docbook}
<para>With <emphasis role="bold">Quick Search</emphasis>, users can directly type a search term in the textbox. All the categories, forums, topics and posts that have the keyword matching the search term will be quickly displayed in the <guilabel>Search Result</guilabel> form.</para>
{docbook}
For example:

* The *Search* function on the main bar to search for items related to categories, forums, topics and posts.

!images/Search_main_bar_forum.png|align="center" width="50mm" fo:scalefit="1" html:scalefit="0"!

* The *Search* function inside one specific forum to find topics and posts in the forum only.

!images/Search_in_forum.png|align="center" width="100" fo:scalefit="1" html:scalefit="0"!

* The *Search* function inside one specific topic to find posts related to the topic only.

!images/Search_in_topic.png|align="center" width="50mm" fo:scalefit="1" html:scalefit="0"!

{docbook}
<citetitle>
<para>
    <emphasis role="bold">Do a quick search</emphasis>
</para>
</citetitle>
{docbook}

*1.* Enter a search term into the relevant search textbox.

{docbook}
<para>
              <emphasis role="bold">2.</emphasis> Click <inlinemediaobject>
                <imageobject role="fo">
                  <imagedata fileref="images/Search_icon.png" format="PNG" scalefit="1" width="4mm"/>
                </imageobject>
                <imageobject role="html">
                  <imagedata fileref="images/Search_icon.png" format="PNG" scalefit="0" width="4mm"/>
                </imageobject>
              </inlinemediaobject> or press the <emphasis role="bold">Enter</emphasis> key to perform your search, or click the <guibutton>Search</guibutton> button if you want to search in one forum or topic.</para>
{docbook}

{docbook}
<para>Depending on your selected object, the results which contain the matching keyword will be displayed in the <guilabel>Search Result</guilabel> form.</para>
{docbook}

{docbook}
<para>
<prompt>
    <emphasis role="bold">See also</emphasis>
</prompt>
</para>
{docbook}

* [View details of the Forum application|#Forum_user_guide.Regular_user.View_details]
* [Advanced search|#Forum_user_guide.Forum_regular_user.Advanced_search]

h3. Advanced search {anchor:id=Forum_user_guide.Forum_regular_user.Advanced_search}

The *Advanced Search* allows users to make a search with particular criteria corresponding to the object you want to find.

{docbook}
<para>
<citetitle>
<emphasis role="bold">
Perform your advanced search
</emphasis>
</citetitle>
</para>
{docbook}

{docbook}
<para>
              <emphasis role="bold">1.</emphasis> Click <inlinemediaobject>
                <imageobject role="fo">
                  <imagedata fileref="images/Advanced_search_icon.png" format="PNG" scalefit="1" width="4mm"/>
                </imageobject>
                <imageobject role="html">
                  <imagedata fileref="images/Advanced_search_icon.png" format="PNG" scalefit="0" width="4mm"/>
                </imageobject>
              </inlinemediaobject> at the top right of the <emphasis role="bold">Forum</emphasis> homepage when being in the <emphasis role="bold">Forum</emphasis> application or in the search pop-up or in the <guilabel>Search this category</guilabel>/<guilabel>Search this forum</guilabel>/<guilabel>Search this topic</guilabel>/ on the <emphasis role="bold">Action</emphasis> bar of each selected object.</para>
{docbook}
Based on the criteria you want to search, such as category, forum or post, the search criteria will be changed accordingly.

*2.* Enter the search criteria.

{docbook}
<para>
              <emphasis role="bold">3.</emphasis> Click the <guibutton>Search</guibutton> button to do search. Also, click the <guibutton>Clear Fields</guibutton> button to reset the inputted values.</para>
{docbook}
{docbook}
<para>Matched results will be shown in the <guilabel>Search Result</guilabel> form. There will be an alert message when there is no object matching with the search criteria.</para>
{docbook}

{docbook}

</citetitle>
{docbook}

h2. Topics {anchor:id=Forum_user_guide.Forum_regular_user.Topics}
Regular users can do many topic-related actions, including:
* [Start a topic|#Forum_regular_user.Topics.Start_topics]
* [Edit a topic|#Forum_regular_user.Topics.Edit_topics]
* [Create a poll|#Forum_regular_user.Topics.Create_poll]
* [Rate a topic|#Forum_regular_user.Topics.Rate_topics]
* [Tag/Untag a topic|#Forum_regular_user.Topics.Tag-Untag_topics]
h3. Start a topic {anchor:id=Forum_regular_user.Topics.Start_topics}

*1.* Go into the forum where you want to start a new topic.

*2.* Click !images/Start_topic_btn.png|width="17mm" fo:scalefit="1" html:scalefit="0"!.

!images/start_topic.png|align="center" width="150mm" fo:scalefit="1" html:scalefit="0"!

*3.* Enter the topic title and its content. The title must be less than 100 characters (special characters are accepted). You may set [other optional properties|#topic_properties] if you want.
{docbook}
<itemizedlist>
              <listitem>
                <para>Click the <guilabel>Attach files</guilabel> link to attach files to your message. The maximum size for the attachment is 20Mb. Click <inlinemediaobject>
                    <imageobject role="fo">
                      <imagedata fileref="images/Delete_icon.png" format="PNG" scalefit="1" width="4"/>
                    </imageobject>
                    <imageobject role="html">
                      <imagedata fileref="images/Delete_icon.png" format="PNG" scalefit="0" width="4"/>
                    </imageobject>
                  </inlinemediaobject> next to the attachment to remove it.</para>
              </listitem>
              <listitem>
                <para>Use <link linkend="Forum_user_settings.Forum_regular_user.BBcodes">BBCodes</link> to format text, or to insert images, videos and links.</para>
              </listitem>
</itemizedlist>
{docbook}

!images/new_topic.png|align="center" width="150mm" fo:scalefit="1" html:scalefit="0"!
{docbook}
<para>
  <emphasis role="bold">4.</emphasis> Click <guibutton>Preview</guibutton> to see before submitting, or <guibutton>Submit</guibutton> to complete your topic.</para>
{docbook}

{docbook}
<note>
    <para>
    In a forum that enables moderation, new topics will need reviewing and approving by moderators before being published.
    </para>
</note>
{docbook}

When creating a topic, you can also add extra properties to this topic: {anchor:id=topic_properties}

* [Select a topic icon|#Forum_regular_user.Topics.Start_topics.Select_topic_icon].
* [Set the topic options|#Forum_regular_user.Topics.Start_topics.Set_topic_options].
* [Control who can view or post in your topic|#Forum_regular_user.Topics.Start_topics.Select_topic_permission].

h4. Select a topic icon {anchor:id=Forum_regular_user.Topics.Start_topics.Select_topic_icon}

When posting a new topic, you may also assign an icon to the topic for the quick visual identification.
{docbook}
<para>
  <emphasis role="bold">1.</emphasis> Go to the <guilabel>Icon</guilabel> tab in the <guilabel>New Topic</guilabel> form.</para>
{docbook}

*2.* Select an icon category, then click your desired icon in the right pane. The selected icon is surrounded with the red border with its name shown below.

!images/new_topic_icon_tab.png|align="center" width="120mm" fo:scalefit="1" html:scalefit="0"!

h4. Set the topic options {anchor:id=Forum_regular_user.Topics.Start_topics.Set_topic_options}
{docbook}
<para>Going to the <guilabel>Options</guilabel> tab, you can select status, state, type of the topic and more.</para>
{docbook}

!images/start_topic_options_tab.png|align="center" width="120mm" fo:scalefit="1" html:scalefit="0"!   {anchor:id="start_topic_options_tab"}

*Details:*
{docbook}
<informaltable>
                <tgroup cols="2">
                  <thead>
                    <row>
                      <entry>Field</entry>
                      <entry>Description</entry>
                    </row>
                  </thead>
                  <tbody>
                    <row>
                      <entry>
                        <guilabel>Type</guilabel>
                      </entry>
                      <entry>Type of the topic specified by the topic type name and its icon. You can select it from the existing types. The administrator can add a new one by clicking <inlinemediaobject>
                          <imageobject role="fo">
                            <imagedata fileref="images/Plus_icon.png" format="PNG" scalefit="1" width="4mm"/>
                          </imageobject>
                          <imageobject role="html">
                            <imagedata fileref="images/Plus_icon.png" format="PNG" scalefit="0" width="4mm"/>
                          </imageobject>
                        </inlinemediaobject> (Note that only administrators can see <inlinemediaobject>
                          <imageobject role="fo">
                            <imagedata fileref="images/Plus_icon.png" format="PNG" scalefit="1" width="4mm"/>
                          </imageobject>
                          <imageobject role="html">
                            <imagedata fileref="images/Plus_icon.png" format="PNG" scalefit="0" width="4mm"/>
                          </imageobject>
                        </inlinemediaobject>.</entry>
                    </row>
                    <row>
                      <entry>
                        <guilabel>Posts Moderation</guilabel>
                        <anchor id="posts_moderation"/>
                      </entry>
                      <entry>Check this option if you want posts to be moderated before being viewed.</entry>
                    </row>
                    <row>
                      <entry>
                        <guilabel>Posts Notification</guilabel>
                      </entry>
                      <entry>Check this option to enable the notification email when there are new posts in your topic.</entry>
                    </row>
                    <row>
                      <entry>
                        <guilabel>Sticky</guilabel>
                      </entry>
                      <entry> Check this option to stick the topic. A sticky topic will be located at the top of the topics list. A sticky topic will not fall down in the list if any new posts are added.</entry>
                    </row>
                  </tbody>
                </tgroup>
              </informaltable>
{docbook}

h4. Set topic permissions {anchor:id=Forum_regular_user.Topics.Start_topics.Select_topic_permission}

{docbook}
<para>Go to the <guilabel>Permissions</guilabel> tab, you can set rights to view and post on your topic for another users. By default, all users can view and reply on a topic.</para>
{docbook}

!images/start_topic_permissions_tab.png|align="center" width="120mm" fo:scalefit="1" html:scalefit="0"!

To set the permission to certain users, you can enter their usernames manually or:

* Click !images/user_selector_icon.png|width="3mm" fo:scalefit="1" html:scalefit="0"! to select users.
* Click !images/Select_membership_icon.png|width="4mm" fo:scalefit="1" html:scalefit="0"! to select users defined by specific roles.
* Click !images/Select_group_icon.png|width="4mm" fo:scalefit="1" html:scalefit="0"! to select groups.

h3. Edit a topic {anchor:id=Forum_regular_user.Topics.Edit_topics}

Regular users can only edit their own topic.

*1.* Click !images/More_actions_btn.png|width="20mm" fo:scalefit="1" html:scalefit="0"! on the *Action* bar. For regular users, this button is only shown when you are the creator.

{docbook}
<para>
<emphasis role="bold">2.</emphasis> Click <guilabel>Edit</guilabel> from the drop-down menu to open the <guilabel>Edit Topic</guilabel> form.</para>
{docbook}

!images/edit_topic_form.png|align="center" width="120mm" fo:scalefit="1" html:scalefit="0"!      {anchor:id="edit_topic_form"}

{docbook}
<para>
<emphasis role="bold">3.</emphasis> Make changes to your desires. Also, leave the reason in the <guilabel>Reason</guilabel> field if needed.</para>
{docbook}

{docbook}
<para>
 <emphasis role="bold">4.</emphasis> Click <guibutton>Submit</guibutton> to finish.</para>
{docbook}

h3. Create a poll {anchor:id=Forum_regular_user.Topics.Create_poll}
Each topic may have a poll question with pre-defined options for users to select. As a regular user, you can only add a poll question to your own topic. Meanwhile, administrator and moderator can add the poll to any topics.

*1.* Go to the topic you want to add a poll.

{docbook}
<para>
              <emphasis role="bold">2.</emphasis> Click <inlinemediaobject>
                <imageobject role="fo">
                  <imagedata fileref="images/More_actions_btn.png" format="PNG" scalefit="1" width="20mm"/>
                </imageobject>
                <imageobject role="html">
                  <imagedata fileref="images/More_actions_btn.png" format="PNG" scalefit="0" width="20mm"/>
                </imageobject>
              </inlinemediaobject> on the <emphasis role="bold">Action</emphasis> bar, then select <guilabel>Add Poll</guilabel> from the drop-down menu.</para>
{docbook}

*3.* Enter the poll question and options.

!images/poll_form.png|align="center" width="120mm" fo:scalefit="1" html:scalefit="0"!

*Details:*
{docbook}
<informaltable>
              <tgroup cols="2">
                <thead>
                  <row>
                    <entry>Field</entry>
                    <entry>Description</entry>
                  </row>
                </thead>
                <tbody>
                  <row>
                    <entry>
                      <guilabel>Poll Question</guilabel>
                    </entry>
                    <entry>Question raised for polling that is required.</entry>
                  </row>
                  <row>

h2. Post {anchor:id=Forum_user_guide.Forum_regular_user.Posts}

* [Type a message in the Quick Reply box at the bottom of the topic|#Forum_regular_user.Posts.Quick_reply].
* [Click the Post Reply button which is on the top or bottom of the topic|#Forum_regular_user.Posts.Advanced_reply].

h2. Use BBCodes {anchor:id=Forum_user_settings.Forum_regular_user.BBcodes}
BBCodes (Bulletin Board Codes) are special tags in bulletin boards that help users enrich their posts with formatting and inclusions. They are useful to provide guarded formatting capabilities to the forum users without the risk of breaking the HTML markup of the page. BBCode itself is similar in style to HTML: tags are enclosed in square braces "\[" and "\]" rather than "\<" and "\>" and it offers greater control over what and how something is displayed.

Depending on the [BBCode template customized|#Forum_Administrator.Administrative_tasks.Customize_BBcodes] by administrators only, you may find it very easy to add BBCodes to your posts through a toolbar above the message area on the posting form. You can either type the BBCode tags manually or use the toolbar in the posting form. To easily get the BBCode tags without typing them, simply click the respective icon which is shown on the toolbar above the message area.

!images/bbccode.png|align="center" width="120mm" fo:scalefit="1" html:scalefit="0"!

Click !images/Syntax_help_btn.png|width="4mm" fo:scalefit="1" html:scalefit="0"! on the toolbar to get the full list of built-in BBCode explanations and examples.

!images/help_bbccode.png|align="center" width="120mm" fo:scalefit="1" html:scalefit="0"!

h2. Bookmarks {anchor:id=Forum_regular_user.Public_user_profile.Bookmarks}
In the *Forum* application, the *Bookmark* function is to collect links to a category, forum or topic you have visited, so that you can return to that category, forum or topic directly. Bookmarks can be created and managed by yourself through the following actions:
* [Add a bookmark|#Public_user_profile.Bookmarks.Add_bookmarks]
* [View bookmarks|#Public_user_profile.Bookmarks.View_bookmarks]
* [Delete a bookmark|#Public_user_profile.Bookmarks.Delete_bookmarks]

h3. Add a bookmark {anchor:id=Public_user_profile.Bookmarks.Add_bookmarks}
This function is for all logged-in users to save links to categories, forums or topics into the Forum Bookmark.

*1.* Go into the object (category, forum or topic) you want to bookmark.

*2.* Click !images/Bookmark_btn.png|width="16mm" fo:scalefit="1" html:scalefit="0"! on the *Action* bar;

{docbook}
<para>Or, right-click the object title and select <guilabel>Bookmark</guilabel> from the drop-down menu. The bookmarked link will be added to your bookmarks list.</para>
{docbook}
h3. View bookmarks {anchor:id=Public_user_profile.Bookmarks.View_bookmarks}
{docbook}
<para>To view bookmarks, click <inlinemediaobject>
                <imageobject role="fo">
                  <imagedata fileref="images/View_bookmarks.png" format="PNG" scalefit="1" width="16mm"/>
                </imageobject>
                <imageobject role="html">
                  <imagedata fileref="images/View_bookmarks.png" format="PNG" scalefit="0" width="16mm"/>
                </imageobject>
              </inlinemediaobject> on the <emphasis role="bold">Action</emphasis> bar. This will bring up the <guilabel>My Bookmarks</guilabel> form, with the list of your bookmarked links. To view the bookmark, click a desired bookmark title from the list.</para>
{docbook}
!images/my_bookmarks.png|align="center" width="300" fo:scalefit="1" html:scalefit="0"!

h3. Delete a bookmark {anchor:id=Public_user_profile.Bookmarks.Delete_bookmarks}

Simply click !images/Delete_icon.png|width="4mm" fo:scalefit="1" html:scalefit="0"! corresponding to the link that you want to delete.

The selected bookmarks will be removed from the bookmarks list.

h2. Subscribe to RSS feeds {anchor:id=Forum_user_guide.Forum_regular_user.Subscriptions}
This function is for all users to subscribe to a specific category, forum, topic. If there are any changes, the feed of the subscribed category, forum or topic will be updated. To get the RSS feed, click !images/forum_rss_btn.png|width="12mm" fo:scalefit="1" html:scalefit="0"! on the *Action* bar.

!images/rss_on_action_bar.png|align="center" width="100mm" fo:scalefit="1" html:scalefit="0"!

Or right-click the item you want to subscribe to.

!images/forum_rss_rightclick.png|align="center" width="100mm" fo:scalefit="1" html:scalefit="0"!

The detailed information of the category/forum/topic is displayed on another tab. Depending on which browser you are using, this page may look different. The browser used in this example is Firefox 8.0.

!images/rss_feed_subscribe_firefox.png|align="center" width="90mm" fo:scalefit="1" html:scalefit="0"!

The following illustration demonstrates the RSS feed subscription using the Firefox Live Bookmark.

!images/rss_example.png|align="center" width="120mm" fo:scalefit="1" html:scalefit="0"!

* Category feeds contain all posts from all topics in all forums in a category. The category feeds shows the title (title of the category), description (category description), link (permalink to the category), pubdate (creation date of the category).

* Forum feeds contain all posts in all topics in a forum. The forum feeds show title (name of the forum), description (description of the forum), link (permalink of the forum), pubdate (creation date of the forum).

* Topic feeds contain all posts in a topic. The topic feeds show title (title of the topic), description (the content of the topic's initial post), link (permalink to the topic), pubdate (the creation date of the topic).


h2. Watch {anchor:id=Forum_user_guide.Forum_regular_user.Bookmarks}
This function is for all logged-in users to keep track of changes in categories, forums or topics via notification emails. Whenever there are new changes, such as new categories, topics, posts created, you will receive a notification.

{docbook}
<para>
<citetitle>
<emphasis role="bold">
Watch a desired object
</emphasis>
</citetitle>
</para>
{docbook}
Go into the object (category, forum or topic), then click !images/Forum_Watch_btn.png|width="10mm" fo:scalefit="1" html:scalefit="0"! on the *Action* bar;

{docbook}
<para>Or, right-click the object title and select <guilabel>Watch</guilabel> from the drop-down menu.</para>
{docbook}
!images/Forum_watch_rightclick.png|align="center" width="80mm" fo:scalefit="1" html:scalefit="0"!

{docbook}
<para>The watched objects are also listed in the <guilabel>My Subscriptions</guilabel> tab in the <guilabel>Settings</guilabel> form. When being unwatched, they also have been existed in this list.</para>
{docbook}
You will receive the notification message of the successful watching.
You will receive the email notifications about new posts/replies of the forum that you are watching as well. In the notification email, you will be provided links that help you go directly to the topic or go to reply to the post. After clicking this link, the new posts in your watched topic will be highlighted.


{docbook}
<note>
    <para>
    Once a category/forum or a topic has already been watched, the <guilabel>Unwatch</guilabel> option will appear in the right-click menu or on the <emphasis role="bold">Action</emphasis> bar, so you can unsubscribe from the object.
    </para>
</note>
{docbook}

              </listitem>
              <listitem>
                <para>Edit your signature which will be displayed at the bottom of your post. Enter your signature in the <guilabel>Signature</guilabel> textbox. Tick/Untick the <guilabel>Display Signature</guilabel> checkbox to enable/disable your signature.</para>
              </listitem>
              <listitem>
                <para>Change your avatar<anchor id="Forum_regular_user.User_settings.Change_your_avatar"/> by clicking the <guilabel>Update</guilabel> link. Tick/Untick the <guilabel>Display Avatar</guilabel> checkbox to show/hide your avatar.</para>
              </listitem>
              <listitem>
                <para>Follow your created topics by selecting the <guilabel>Watch topics I start</guilabel> checkbox. You will receive email notifications when there are any new posts added to your topics.</para>
              </listitem>
              <listitem>
                <para>Follow topics which you have posted by ticking the <guilabel>Watch topics I post in</guilabel> checkbox. You will receive email notifications when there are any new posts added to your created topic.</para>
              </listitem>
            </itemizedlist>
{docbook}
h3. Change forum settings {anchor:id=Forum_regular_user.User_settings.Change_forum_settings}

{docbook}
<para>Go to the <guilabel>Forum Settings</guilabel> tab in the <guilabel>Settings</guilabel> form. You can change preferences, such as time zone, date and time formats, and other display options.</para>
{docbook}
!images/settings_forum_tab.png|align="center" width="120mm" fo:scalefit="1" html:scalefit="0"!

{docbook}
<para>Check/Uncheck the <guilabel>Show Forum Jump</guilabel> if you want to show/hide the <guilabel>Forum quick navigation</guilabel> at the bottom of the <emphasis role="bold">Forum</emphasis> page.</para>
{docbook}

h3. Edit your subscription {anchor:id=Forum_regular_user.User_settings.Manage_subscriptions}
{docbook}
<para>Go to the <guilabel>My Subscriptions</guilabel> tab in the <guilabel>Settings</guilabel> form, where you can update or delete existing subscriptions.</para>
{docbook}
!images/settings_my_subscriptions.png|align="center" width="120mm" fo:scalefit="1" html:scalefit="0"!

{docbook}
<itemizedlist>
              <listitem>
                <para>In <inlinemediaobject>
                    <imageobject role="fo">
                      <imagedata fileref="images/RSS_icon.png" format="PNG" scalefit="1" width="4mm"/>
                    </imageobject>
                    <imageobject role="html">
                      <imagedata fileref="images/RSS_icon.png" format="PNG" scalefit="0" width="4mm"/>
                    </imageobject>
                  </inlinemediaobject> column, you can subscribe or unsubscribe your subscriptions by selecting/deselecting the respective checkboxes, then click <guibutton>Save</guibutton>. The selected objects (categories, forums, topics) will be updated to the <guilabel>Your personal feed URL is</guilabel> field. You can use this link to view the content of your subscriptions.</para>
              </listitem>
              <listitem>
                <para>In the <inlinemediaobject>
                    <imageobject role="fo">
                      <imagedata fileref="images/Mail_icon.png" format="PNG" scalefit="1" width="4mm"/>
                    </imageobject>
                    <imageobject role="html">
                      <imagedata fileref="images/Mail_icon.png" format="PNG" scalefit="0" width="4mm"/>
                    </imageobject>
                  </inlinemediaobject> column, you can edit or delete your subscription email. Select an email, then click <inlinemediaobject>
                    <imageobject role="fo">
                      <imagedata fileref="images/Delete_icon.png" format="PNG" scalefit="1" width="4mm"/>
                    </imageobject>
                    <imageobject role="html">
                      <imagedata fileref="images/Delete_icon.png" format="PNG" scalefit="0" width="4mm"/>
                    </imageobject>
                  </inlinemediaobject> to delete. Enter a new email address into the <guilabel>Your watches are sent to</guilabel> field. Click <guilabel>Update</guilabel> to add your entered email addresses in the <inlinemediaobject>
                    <imageobject role="fo">
                      <imagedata fileref="images/Mail_icon.png" format="PNG" scalefit="1" width="4mm"/>
                    </imageobject>
                    <imageobject role="html">
                      <imagedata fileref="images/Mail_icon.png" format="PNG" scalefit="0" width="4mm"/>
                    </imageobject>
                  </inlinemediaobject> column.</para>
              </listitem>
              <listitem>
                <para>Click <inlinemediaobject>
                    <imageobject role="fo">
                      <imagedata fileref="images/Delete_icon.png" format="PNG" scalefit="1" width="4mm"/>
                    </imageobject>
                    <imageobject role="html">
                      <imagedata fileref="images/Delete_icon.png" format="PNG" scalefit="0" width="4mm"/>
                    </imageobject>
                  </inlinemediaobject> to remove your watched category, topic, post. After being removed, you will no longer receive any email notifications of the removed object.</para>
              </listitem>
            </itemizedlist>
{docbook}

{docbook}
 <para>Next, click <guibutton>Save</guibutton> to accept your changes.</para>
{docbook}
